abstract: Top level tennis players with surnames that are difficult to pronounce can find themselves irritated, or even struggling to concentrate, when chair umpires consistently mispronounce their names during a match; broadcasters also struggle, in a sport that represents 51 nationalities in top 100 rankings; all three governing bodies of game--ATP, WTA and International Tennis Federation--acknowledge no formal protocol exists for chair umpires that could help them with correct pronunciations on the court.
lead_paragraph: At tournaments such as the United States Open, with a field represented by dozens of nationalities, mispronunciations of players’ names are nearly a certainty.

headline.main: Players’ Names Spawn a Mouthful of Errors
headline.print_headline: Players’ Names Spawn a Mouthful of Errors

snippet: At tournaments such as the United States Open, with a field represented by dozens of nationalities, mispronunciations of players’ names are nearly a certainty.
